description: Clipped from wampumpeag (from Narragansett [Term?]; compare the opposite clipping peag), which is a compound of wamp, wompi (“white”) + umpe (“string”) + -ag (plural suffix), and referred to the string of white shell-beads rather than the individual beads.

nouns.description: wampum (countable and uncountable, plural wampums or wampum)

entries.meaning: Small beads made from polished shells, especially white ones, formerly used as money and jewelry by certain Native American peoples.
